triples.name: Functional programming
triples.relevance: Functional programming is the foundational paradigm that the paper extends with I/O semantics.

triples.name: Lambda calculus
triples.relevance: Lambda calculus is the theoretical foundation for functional programming, on which the paper's operational semantics is built.

triples.name: Operational semantics
triples.relevance: The paper develops novel operational semantics for functional I/O based entirely on Abramsky's applicative bisimulation.

triples.name: Bisimulation
triples.relevance: Applicative bisimulation (Abramsky's work) provides the theoretical foundation for the operational semantics developed in the paper.

triples.name: Lazy evaluation
triples.relevance: The paper addresses I/O for lazy languages and provides operational semantics for the three most widely implemented I/O mechanisms.

triples.name: Monad (functional programming)
triples.relevance: The paper develops and verifies semantics for monadic I/O, demonstrating how monads can structure I/O operations.

triples.name: Formal verification
triples.relevance: The paper proves program properties and verifies programs engaged in I/O, advancing formal verification techniques for functional programs.
